message: install visual studio code 2015 >>>> 8 hours later >> open visual studio >>> 5 minutes later >>> uninstall visual studio >>> open sublime text 3 :D

data.message: قشطة يعني انت تقدر ت develop ب notepad حتى لكن السؤال انت بتعمل ايه بال .net framework + sublime ? :D

In my experience mentoring 3 .NET teams going Angular 2, Visual Studio 2015 seems to have more or less the same features of VS Code when it comes to TypeScript, except with horrible performance. All the developers now hate to open Visual Studio even for C# work because of that.

My plan next week is to make the Angular 2 app excluded from the .NET project (except for deployable artifacts, long story, been lazy on the blog post for a few weeks now). VS is awesome for C#, and VS Code is awesome for TypeScript.

If you do JS though, and you are happy to pay < $100, go WebStorm, and don't look back. It's incredible. I'm using the pre-released version 2016.3, which you can download for free and use for a trial period, that (I think) resets every time you download a newer daily build. The TypeScript support is just like C#+R# if not better, and you get the awesomeness even in Angular 2 or JSX templates.
try phpstorm or webstorm you can code Typescript , or any other JetBrain products
Try Rodeo IDE for python you will like it :D
